Package com.cafean.client.ui.swing.accordion

Class Accordion

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • com.cafean.client.ui.swing.accordion.Accordion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    public class Accordion
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    This class allows creating accordion components. An accordion functions like a list whose entries can be expanded to display complex contents. In this expanded state, a set number of entries in the list are displayed above and below the expanded element, assuming any such elements exist before and after the expanded element.

    An AccordionModel implementation determines the contents of the acordion. Each element in the model is displayed as one node in the accordion. The contents of the node are determined by the object's Component.toString() method, unless the object extends AccordionNode. Such subclassed objects can set a custom string, icon, tooltip, pop-up menu, etc.. An AccordionRenderer is used to retrieve the component displayed when a given model value is expanded.

    Accordion adheres to somewhat unusual semantics for its events. ActionListeners are notified when an expanded node receives a single click. The ID of the dispatched ActionEvent is set to the index of the associated node.

    Single clicks do not contract an expanded node, they merely fire an action. Double clicks contract an expanded node. Single clicks expand a contracted node. AccordionExpansionListeners will be notified when a node is expanded or contracted.

    Roughly parallel to the expanded state is the selected state. Expanding a node selects it. Contracting a node does not deselect it. The selection of an accordion is only cleared when the selected object is removed from the underlying data model or a clear is requested programmatically. AccordionSelectionListeners will be notified when the selection changes.

    See Also:
